comments.body:
This will list all remote branches, for example:

```
...
  upstream/alpha
  upstream/android-launcher-icons
  upstream/codelab
  upstream/codelab2
  upstream/hackathon
  upstream/master
...
```

Flutter only has 'alpha', and 'master' channels right? Maybe we want to further filter this list for end users.

Good point, but I would not want to hard code a fixed list into flutter. Perhaps there should be a list of prefixes of branches that should be ignored. At the moment, there are only 6 branches in the flutter repo...

```
alpha
master
hackathon
revert-5426-build-sdk-summary
codelab
codelab2
```

I think that `hackathon*` and `codelab*` could be (are?) valid channels that we could use for planned events, but `revert*` should definitely be excluded.

We could ignore any branches that start with
- revert
- test
- any others?

@sethladd Any thoughts on what branches should be listed / excluded?

I wouldn't bother adding an exclude list.  We'll just keep it clean.

On Tue, Aug 23, 2016 at 7:11 PM, Dan Rubel notifications@github.com wrote:

> In packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/commands/channel.dart
> https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/5561#discussion_r75984737:
> 
> > -        currentBranch = line;
> > -        return null;
> > -      },
> > -    );
> >   +
> > -    printStatus('Flutter channels:');
> > -    return runCommandAndStreamOutput(
> > -      <String>['git', 'branch', '-r'],
> > -      workingDirectory: Cache.flutterRoot,
> > -      mapFunction: (String line) {
> > -        List<String> split = line.split('/');
> > -        if (split.length < 2) return null;
> > -        String branchName = split[1];
> > -        if (branchName.startsWith('HEAD')) return null;
> > -        if (branchName == currentBranch) return '\* $branchName';
> > -        return '  $branchName';
> 
> Good point, but I would not want to hard code a fixed list into flutter.
> Perhaps there should be a list of prefixes of branches that should be
> ignored. At the moment, there are only 6 branches in the flutter repo...
> 
> alpha
> master
> hackathon
> revert-5426-build-sdk-summary
> codelab
> codelab2
> 
> I think that hackathon\* and codelab\* could be (are?) valid channels that
> we could use for planned events, but revert\* should definitely be
> excluded.
> 
> We could ignore any branches that start with
> - revert
> - test
> - any others?
> 
> @sethladd https://github.com/sethladd Any thoughts on what branches
> should be listed / excluded?
> 
> —

Deleted the spurious branches.

On Tue, Aug 23, 2016 at 7:14 PM, Eric Seidel eseidel@google.com wrote:

> I wouldn't bother adding an exclude list.  We'll just keep it clean.

> On Tue, Aug 23, 2016 at 7:11 PM, Dan Rubel notifications@github.com

> > > -        return null;

> > > -    return runCommandAndStreamOutput(

> > > -      workingDirectory: Cache.flutterRoot,
> > > -      mapFunction: (String line) {
> > > -        List<String> split = line.split('/');
> > > -        if (split.length < 2) return null;
> > > -        String branchName = split[1];
> > > -        if (branchName.startsWith('HEAD')) return null;
> > > -        if (branchName == currentBranch) return '\* $branchName';
> > > -        return '  $branchName';
> > 
> > Good point, but I would not want to hard code a fixed list into flutter.
> > Perhaps there should be a list of prefixes of branches that should be
> > ignored. At the moment, there are only 6 branches in the flutter repo...
> > 
> > alpha
> > master
> > hackathon
> > revert-5426-build-sdk-summary
> > codelab
> > codelab2
> > 
> > I think that hackathon\* and codelab\* could be (are?) valid channels that
> > we could use for planned events, but revert\* should definitely be
> > excluded.
> >

> > —
> > You are receiving this because you commented.
> > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> > https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/5561/files/7126e2c9a00f14e9944aa9050ebb9e6de9aab311#r75984737,
> > or mute the thread
> > https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ALTvi9S7X4PGjBK8ceJ7g_2vAEaG_iufks5qi6hagaJpZM4JrYW5
> > .

I think a hard-coded list would be ok. The channels wouldn't change much, and when it does we can update the list.

@danrubel, there's an existing list here: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/master/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/version.dart#L10. We should share that list w/ this command (probably it lives in `channel.dart`?), and remove the channels that don't currently exist.
Per Eric's comment, I'll leave it as it is and we'll keep the main repo branches clean. Happy to revisit this in a subsequent issue / PR.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +15,19 @@  ChannelCommand({ bool verboseHelp: false }) {
    argParser.addFlag(
      'all',
      abbr: 'a',
      help: 'Include all the available branches (including local branches) when listing channels.',
